definitions.text: the person who plays the position of forward in certain games, such as basketball, soccer, or hockey
a position on a basketball, soccer, or hockey team
send or ship onward from an intermediate post or station in transit
at or near or directed toward the front
examples: the forward section of the aircraft
a forward plunge down the stairs

definitions.text: used of temperament or behavior; lacking restraint or modesty
examples: a forward child badly in need of discipline

definitions.text: of the transmission gear causing forward movement in a motor vehicle
at or to or toward the front; ; ; ; (`forrad' and `forrard' are dialectal variations)
examples: she practiced sewing backward as well as frontward on her new sewing machine

definitions.text: forward in time or order or degree
toward the future; forward in time
examples: I like to look ahead in imagination to what the future may bring
I look forward to seeing you
they went slowly forward in the mud

definitions.text: near or toward the bow of a ship or cockpit of a plane
examples: the captain went fore (or forward) to check the instruments
